newsitem.title: CHINA: China to turn rural credit agencies into banks.
newsitem.headline: China to turn rural credit agencies into banks.

text.p: China plans to reform its tens of thousands of rural credit agencies, transforming them into genuine cooperative banking institutions in the next two years, central bank governor Dai Xianglong has said.

Dai, governor of the People's Bank of China, was speaking at the opening of a conference on reforming the administrative system of the rural banking sector, the official Xinhua news agency said in an overnight report.
To build rural credit agencies into cooperative banking institutions was in line with demands of rural economic development and banking reform, he said.
When rural credit agencies become cooperative banking institutions they will be able to raise funds for the agricultural sector effectively, he said.

China's more than 50,000 credit agencies scattered across the country have been separated from control by the Agricultural Bank of China and will operate independently under the administration of over 2,000 county-based local headquarters, he said.
